snippet: As Hurricane Sandy overwhelmed New York City, threatening New York University research buildings in Kips Bay, researchers from around the world rushed to offer assistance.
abstract: New York University received offers of help from research institutions worldwide, many of them direct competitors, as flood waters from Hurricane Sandy surged into its facilities on Manhattan's East Side; response reflects generational shift as researchers increasingly share expensive or difficult-to-produce resources, even while individual labs continue to compete with each other.
lead_paragraph: As Hurricane Sandy overwhelmed New York City, threatening New York University research buildings in Kips Bay, researchers from around the world rushed to offer assistance.

headline.seo: A Collective Effort to Save Decades of Research at N.Y.U.
headline.main: A Collective Effort to Save Decades of Research as the Water Rose
headline.print_headline: A Collective Effort to Save Decades of Research as the Water Rose
